name: com.unity.sentis
description:
The Sentis package is a neural network inference library for Unity. You can use Sentis to import trained neural network models into Unity, then run them in real time locally on any platform Unity supports and in the Editor. You can run models on the GPU or the CPU.

You can use Sentis to run models that do style transfer, generate assets, automate non-player character (NPC) logic, and much more

Visit https://discussions.unity.com/c/10 for updates and resources on the Sentis beta, including a full sample project.

samples.description: An example of adding a custom layer to implement a custom ONNX operator.

samples.displayName: Check the metadata of a model
samples.description: An example of checking the metadata of a model.
Examples of converting tensors to textures.
Examples of converting textures to textures.

samples.displayName: Copy a texture tensor to the screen
samples.description: An example of using TextureConverter.RenderToScreen to copy a texture tensor to the screen.

samples.displayName: Do an operation on a tensor
samples.description: An example of using Ops to do an operation on a tensor.
Examples of reading the output from a model asynchronously, using compute shaders or Burst.

samples.displayName: Run a model a layer at a time
samples.description: An example of using StartManualSchedule to run a model a layer a time.
Examples of running models with different numbers of inputs and outputs.
An example of using a compute shader to write data to a tensor on the GPU.
An example of using Burst to write data to a tensor in the Job system.
Examples of using tensor indexing methods to get and set tensor values.
